name: Applications
description: Internal platforms, SaaS tooling, and business systems.

config.purpose: Map business capabilities to the systems that deliver them.

notes: <Application> must declare an accountable department and policy coverage.

orchestration.summary: <Application> data captures ownership, criticality, and dependencies so orchestration can steer system lifecycle decisions.
signals: Requests mention specific internal platforms, SaaS tools, or business systems.
The user needs to confirm which department owns or governs an application.
The question asks for dependencies between applications, policies, or operational resources.
escalateWhen: The request references an application missing from records or without ownership details.
The user needs live operational metrics or change history beyond the static dataset.

relevantDataManager.focus: Expose required metadata, dependencies, and governance expectations for applications.
signals: The orchestrator needs required fields to onboard or audit an application entry.
The workflow must understand which policies or resources relate to an application.
The caller needs the folder structure to supply updated schemas or examples.
promptStarters: Relevant data manager, list the required metadata and relationships for `<application>`.
Relevant data manager, summarize the policies and resources linked to `<application>`.
Relevant data manager, describe the folder blueprint for the applications dataset.

databaseAgent.focus: Run targeted queries across <application> records for ownership, criticality, and compliance coverage.
signals: We need a list of <application> filtered by department, tier, or compliance posture.
We must cross-reference policies or resources for multiple <application> at once.
We are validating referential integrity between <application> and other categories.
promptStarters: Database agent, list all <application> owned by `<department>` with their criticality levels.
Database agent, show <application> missing policies covering `<standard>`.
Database agent, cross-reference `<application>` with its supporting resources.

dataAgent.focus: Provide narratives about how <application> support the business and highlight risks or opportunities.
signals: Stakeholders need an onboarding brief about <application> usage across departments.
Leaders want an explanation of how <application> align with policies and resources.
The orchestrator must plan multi-step investigations that combine <application> data with other categories.
promptStarters: Data agent, craft an overview of how `<department>` relies on `<application>`.
Data agent, highlight risks for `<application>` based on its criticality and policy coverage.
Data agent, propose a review plan for <application> supporting `<business process>`.
